metadata.Title: CVE-2021-34552 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
Pillow through 8.2.0 and PIL (aka Python Imaging Library) through 1.1.7allow an attacker to pass controlled parameters directly into a convertfunction to trigger a buffer overflow in Convert.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-34552` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 8.1.2+dfsg-0.3
python3-pil.imagetk - 8.1.2+dfsg-0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.2+dfsg-0.3').
